Issue #29 Citroën ZX Rallye Raid Evo 4 1995 P. Lartigue/M. Périn

For the first time in the history of the rally, the race did not depart from France, but from Grenada, Spain on January 1. The race continued through Morocco, Mauritania, Guinea, and finished in Dakar, Senegal on January 15 for a total of 3,557 competitive miles.

The ZX entered in the 1995 Dakar was the 4th evolution of the vehicle and was introduced in 1994. The front and rear fenders had been widened yet again and the wheel-arches had a more aggressive circular shape. The side skirt was widened to connect both wheel-arches more smoothly. The nose and grille were modified to resemble the facelifted production ZX.

The ZX of Lartigue and Périn carried them to victory in the T3 class and victory overall despite winning only 3 stages.
